summary: The concept of "fermented milk" falls under the category of processed agricultural produce within EU legal and regulatory frameworks. It encompasses dairy products that undergo fermentation, resulting in distinct flavors and textures. The production of fermented milk is subject to various EU regulations, including hygiene standards and labeling requirements, ensuring consumer safety and product quality. Additionally, the European Food Safety Authority (EFSA) evaluates health claims associated with fermented milk, promoting transparency and informed consumer choices. This concept is integral to the EU's agricultural policies, supporting both traditional practices and modern food innovation in the dairy sector.
